member.name: T:BitMiracle.LibTiff.Classic.TiffRgbaImage.PutContigDelegate
member.summary: Delegate for "put" method (the method that is called to pack pixel data in the raster) used when converting contiguously packed samples.
member.param: The raster (the buffer to place decoded image data to).
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing decoded bytes.
The value that should be added to after each row processed.
The x-coordinate of the first pixel in block of pixels to be decoded.
The y-coordinate of the first pixel in block of pixels to be decoded.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin reading image bytes.
The value that should be added to after each row processed.

remarks.para: The image reading and conversion methods invoke "put" methods to copy/image/whatever tiles of raw image data. A default set of methods is provided to convert/copy raw image data to 8-bit packed ABGR format rasters. Applications can supply alternate methods that unpack the data into a different format or, for example, unpack the data and draw the unpacked raster on the display.
To setup custom "put" method for contiguously packed samples please use property.

The is usually 0. It is greater than 0 if width of strip being converted is greater than image width or part of the tile being converted is outside the image (may be true for tiles on the right and bottom edge of the image). In other words, is used to make up for any padding on the end of each line of the buffer with image data.

The is 0 if width of tile being converted is equal to image width and image data should not be flipped vertically. In other circumstances is used to make up for any padding on the end of each line of the raster and/or for flipping purposes.

member.name: T:BitMiracle.LibTiff.Classic.TiffRgbaImage.PutSeparateDelegate
member.summary: Delegate for "put" method (the method that is called to pack pixel data in the raster) used when converting separated samples.
member.param: The raster (the buffer to place decoded image data to).
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing decoded bytes.
The value that should be added to after each row processed.
The x-coordinate of the first pixel in block of pixels to be decoded.
The y-coordinate of the first pixel in block of pixels to be decoded.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin reading image bytes that constitute first sample plane.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin reading image bytes that constitute second sample plane.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin reading image bytes that constitute third sample plane.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin reading image bytes that constitute fourth sample plane.
The value that should be added to , , and after each row processed.

remarks.para: The image reading and conversion methods invoke "put" methods to copy/image/whatever tiles of raw image data. A default set of methods is provided to convert/copy raw image data to 8-bit packed ABGR format rasters. Applications can supply alternate methods that unpack the data into a different format or, for example, unpack the data and draw the unpacked raster on the display.
To setup custom "put" method for separated samples please use property.

The is usually 0. It is greater than 0 if width of strip being converted is greater than image width or part of the tile being converted is outside the image (may be true for tiles on the right and bottom edge of the image). In other words, is used to make up for any padding on the end of each line of the buffer with image data.

The is 0 if width of tile being converted is equal to image width and image data should not be flipped vertically. In other circumstances is used to make up for any padding on the end of each line of the raster and/or for flipping purposes.

member.name: M:BitMiracle.LibTiff.Classic.TiffStream.Read(System.Object,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: A client data (by default, an underlying stream).
An array of bytes. When this method returns, the contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the . This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: A client data (by default, an underlying stream).
An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.COM.IWorkbook.Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets the CultureInfo using in Workbook. This property should be used to set the locale (regional) settings for use in the new workbook (number, currency, time, date formatting). When you load existing spreadsheet then the SDK tries to use the saved locale settings for this file disregarding current Windows regional and language settings. When new workbook is created then the current Windows locale is used by default

member.name: M:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Formula.XLSBuiltInFunc.HLOOKUP(System.Object[],Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Cell)
member.summary:
Performs a horizontal search for a value in the top row of a table or an array, noting the column in which the matching value is found. From that column, the value from a given row is returned.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the fill types.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Solid
member.summary: (0) The shape is filled with a single solid color.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Pattern
member.summary: (1) The shape is filled with a single repeatable pattern.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Texture
member.summary: (2) The shape is filled with a repeatable image.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Picture
member.summary: (3) An image is scaled to fit entirely within the shape.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Shade
member.summary: (4) The shape is filled with a gradient that starts and ends with defined endpoints.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.ShadeCenter
member.summary: (5) The shape is filled with a gradient that starts and ends based on the bounds of the shape.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.ShadeShape
member.summary: (6) The shape is filled with a gradient that starts on the outline and ends at a point defined within the shape.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.ShadeScale
member.summary: (7) The shape is filled with a gradient that starts on the outline and ends at a point defined within the shape. The fill angle is scaled by the aspect ratio of the shape.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.ShadeTitle
member.summary: (8) The shape is filled with a gradient. This style is intended for slide titles.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.FillType.Background
member.summary: (9) The shape is filled using the fill properties of the background, simulating transparency.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.ScaleHeight(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scales the height of the picture by a specified factor.
member.param: Specifies the ratio between the height of the shape after you resize it and the current or original height.
if set to true [to scale the picture relative to its original size]; if set to false [to scale it relative to its current size].

member.name: M:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.ScaleWidth(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scales the width of the picture by a specified factor.
member.param: Specifies the ratio between the width of the shape after you resize it and the current or original width.
if set to true [to scale the picture relative to its original size]; if set to false [to scale it relative to its current size].

member.summary: Gets or sets the value specified how much to crop the image from the top down as a fraction of picture size.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.CropFromLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specified how much to crop the image from the left in as a fraction of picture size.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.CropFromRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the value specified how much to crop the image from the right in as a fraction of picture size.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast of the picture. The minimum value of 0.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with no contrast. The maximum value of 1.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with maximum contrast. The default value for this property is 0.5 and specifies no change to the contrast of the picture.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness of the picture. The minimum value of 0.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with the minimum brightness (dimmest). The maximum value of 1.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with the maximum brightness (brightest). The default value for this property is 0.5 and specifies no change to the brightness of the picture.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.ColorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of color transformation applied to the picture.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.IPictureShape.LockAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the aspect ratio of this picture is locked.
member.value: true if [lock aspect ratio]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.PictureShape.ScaleHeight(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scales the height of the picture by a specified factor.
member.param: Specifies the ratio between the height of the shape after you resize it and the current or original height.
if set to true [to scale the picture relative to its original size]; if set to false [to scale it relative to its current size].

member.name: M:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.PictureShape.ScaleWidth(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Scales the width of the picture by a specified factor.
member.param: Specifies the ratio between the width of the shape after you resize it and the current or original width.
if set to true [to scale the picture relative to its original size]; if set to false [to scale it relative to its current size].

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.PictureShape.CropFromRight

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.PictureShape.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast of the picture. The minimum value of 0.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with no contrast. The maximum value of 1.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with maximum contrast. The default value for this property is 0.5 and specifies no change to the contrast of the picture.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.MSODrawing.PictureShape.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness of the picture. The minimum value of 0.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with the minimum brightness (dimmest). The maximum value of 1.0 specifies that the picture is rendered with the maximum brightness (brightest). The default value for this property is 0.5 and specifies no change to the brightness of the picture.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of color transformation applied to the picture.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.EverOpenMemoryStream
member.summary: The purpose of this class is to provide a stream that can't get closed. We need such un-closable stream only because 1.1 version of XmlWriter can not be used without closing underlaying stream and we do not want underlaying stream to be closed (i.e. we do not want to close zip file entry's stream)

member.summary: Do Not Move or Resize With Underlying Rows/Columns

member.summary: Move With Cells but Do Not Resize

member.summary: Move and Resize With Anchor Cells

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorType.AbsoluteAnchor
member.summary: This element is used as an anchor placeholder for a shape or group of shapes. It anchors the object in the same position relative to sheet position and its extents are in EMU units.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorType.OneCellAnchor
member.summary: This element specifies a one cell anchor placeholder for a group, a shape, or a drawing element. It moves with the cell and its extents is in EMU units.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorType.TwoCellAnchor
member.summary: This element specifies a two cell anchor placeholder for a group, a shape, or a drawing element. It moves with cells and its extents are in EMU units.

This record specifies the patterns and colors used in a filled region of a chart.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.3 AreaFormat

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAreaFormat.rgbFore
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the foreground color of the fill pattern. The default value of this field is automatically selected from the next available color in the chart (section 2.2.3.3) color table.
Excel 97, Excel 2000, Excel 2002, Office Excel 2003, Office Excel 2007, and Excel 2010 write a value for this field but ignore it on load
member.value: The foreground color of the fill pattern.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAreaFormat.rgbBack
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the background color of the fill pattern. The default value of this field is 0xFFFFFF.
Excel 97, Excel 2000, Excel 2002, Office Excel 2003, Office Excel 2007, and Excel 2010 write a value for this field but ignore it on load
member.value: The background color of the fill pattern.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAreaFormat.fls
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the type of fill pattern.

member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the foreground color of the fill pattern from the chart color table.
The default value of this field is automatically selected from the next available color in the chart (section 2.2.3.3) color table.
member.value: The foreground color of the fill pattern from the chart color table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAreaFormat.icvBack
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the background color of the fill pattern from the chart color table.
The default value of this field is 0x0009.
member.value: The background color of the fill pattern from the chart color table.

member.summary: Length of formula string

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt
member.summary:
This record specifies additional extension properties of a date axis, along with a CatSerRange record.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.9 AxcExt

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.catMin
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the minimum date, as a date in the date system specified by the Date1904 record, in the units defined by duBase. SHOULD be less than or equal to catMax. If fAutoMin is set to 1, MUST be ignored. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.catMax
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the maximum date, as a date in the date system specified by the Date1904 record, in the units defined by duBase. SHOULD be greater than or equal to catMin. If fAutoMax is set to 1, MUST be ignored. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.catMajor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval at which the major tick marks are displayed on the axis, in the unit defined by duMajor. MUST be greater than or equal to catMinor when duMajor is equal to duMinor. If fAutoMajor is set to 1, MUST be ignored. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.duMajor
P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.catMinor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval at which the minor tick marks are displayed on the axis, in a unit defined by duMinor. MUST be less than or equal to catMajor when duMajor is equal to duMinor. If fAutoMinor is set to 1, MUST be ignored. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.duMinor
P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.duBase
member.summary: Gets A DateUnit enumeration that specifies the smallest unit of time used by the axis. If fAutoBase is set to 1, this field MUST be ignored. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxcExt.catCrossDate
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies at which date, as a date in the date system specified by the Date1904 record, in the units defined by duBase, the value axis crosses this axis. If fDateAxis is set to 0, MUST be ignored. If fAutoCross is set to 1, MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxesUsed
member.summary:
This record specifies the number of axis groups on the chart.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.10 AxesUsed

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxesUsed.cAxes
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the number of axis groups on the chart. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0001 - A single primary axis group is present. 0x0002 - Both a primary axis group and a secondary axis group are present.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxis
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of an axis and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF that specifies an axis.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.11 Axis

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxis.wType
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the type of axis. The value MUST be 0x0000 if the record is the first axis in the axis group. The value MUST be 0x0001 if the record is the second axis in the axis group. The value MUST be 0x0002 if the record is the third axis in the axis group. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - Axis type is a horizontal value axis for a scatter chart group or a bubble chart group, or category axis for all other chart group types. 0x0001 - Axis type is a vertical value axis for a scatter chart group or a bubble chart group, or value axis for all other chart group types. 0x0002 - Axis type is a series axis.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxisLine
member.summary:
This record specifies which part of the axis is specified by the LineFormat record that follows.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.9 AxcExt

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxisLine.id
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies which part of the axis is defined by the LineFormat record that follows be unique among all other id field values in AxisLine records in the current axis. MUST be greater than the id field values in preceding AxisLine records in the current axis. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - The axis line itself. 0x0001 - The major gridlines along the axis. 0x0002 - The minor gridlines along the axis. 0x0003 - The walls or floor of a 3-D chart.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxisParent
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of an axis group and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF that specifies an axis group.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.13 AxisParent

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffAxisParent.iax
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether the axis group is primary or secondary.
member.value: true if axis group is secondary; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar
member.summary:
This record specifies that the chart group is a bar chart group or a column chart group, and specifies the chart group attributes.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.15 Bar

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.pcOverlap
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the overlap between data points in the same category as a percentage of the data points width. MUST be greater than or equal to -100 and less than or equal to 100. MUST be a value from the following table: -100 to -1 - Size of the separation between data points. 0 - No overlap. 1 to 100 - Size of the overlap between data points.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.pcGap
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the width of the gap between the categories and the left and right edges of the plot area as a percentage of the data point width divided by 2. It also specifies the width of the gap between adjacent categories as a percentage of the data point width. MUST be less than or equal to 500.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.fTranspose
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points and value axis are horizontal (for a bar chart group (fTranspose == true)) or vertical (for a column chart group (fTranspose == false)).

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.fStacked
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points in the chart group that share the same category (3) are stacked.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.f100
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points in the chart group are displayed as a percentage of the sum of all data points in the chart group that share the same category (3). MUST be 0 if fStacked is 0.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBar.fHasShadow
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether one or more data points in the chart group has shadows.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBegin
member.summary:
This record specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.17 Begin

member.summary:
This record specifies image data for a sheet background.

This record specifies the beginning of the individual substreams. It also specifies history information for the substreams.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.21 BOF

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.Version
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the Binary Interchange File Format (BIFF) version of the file. BIFF5/7 - 0x0500 BIFF8 - 0x0600

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.Type
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the document type of the substream of records following this record.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.CreationID
member.summary: Creation ID (build identifier)
member.remarks: Not used before BIFF5

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.CreationYear
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the year when this Binary Interchange File Format (BIFF) version was first created. The value MUST be 0x07CC(Excel 97) or 0x07CD.
member.remarks: Not used before BIFF5

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.HistoryFlag
member.summary: File history flag
member.remarks: Not used before BIFF8

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBOF.MinVersionToOpen
member.summary: Minimum Excel version to open this file
member.remarks: Not used before BIFF8

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoolErrCell
member.summary: Represents a constant integer number in range 0..65535

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoolErrCell.Value
member.summary: Returns value of this cell

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoolErrCell.ValueType
member.summary: Returns value of this cell

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop
member.summary:
This record specifies that the chart group is a bar of pie chart group or a pie of pie chart group and specifies the chart group attributes.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.25 BopPop

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.pst
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies whether this chart group is a bar of pie chart group or a pie of pie chart group.
MUST be a value from the following table: 0x01 - Pie of pie chart group 0x02 - Bar of pie chart group
member.value: The value that specifies whether this chart group is a bar of pie or a pie of pie chart.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.fAutoSplit
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether the split point of the chart group is determined automatically. If the value is 1, when a bar of pie chart group or pie of pie chart group is initially created the data points from the primary pie are selected and inserted into the secondary bar/pie automatically.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.split
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies what determines the split between the primary pie and the secondary bar/pie. MUST be ignored if fAutoSplit is set to 1.
MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - Position The data is split based on the position of the data point in the series as specified by iSplitPos. 0x0001 - Value The data is split based on a threshold value as specified by numSplitValue. 0x0002 - Percent The data is split based on a percentage threshold and the data point values represented as a percentage as specified by pcSplitPercent. 0x0003 - Custom The data is split as arranged by the user. Custom split is specified in a following BopPopCustom record.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.iSplitPos
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies how many data points are contained in the secondary bar/pie.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.pcSplitPercent
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the percentage below which each data point is contained in the secondary bar/pie as opposed to the primary pie.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.pcPie2Size
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the size of the secondary bar/pie as a percentage of the size of the primary pie. MUST be a value greater than or equal to 5 and less than or equal to 200.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.pcGap
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the distance between the primary pie and the secondary bar/pie.
member.value: The distance between the primary pie and the secondary bar/pie.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBopPop.numSplitValue
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the split when the split field is set to 0x0001.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoundSheet
member.summary: Represents Sheet record in Workbook Globals

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoundSheet.StartOffset
member.summary: Worksheet data start offset

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoundSheet.Type
member.summary: Type of worksheet

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoundSheet.VisibleState
member.summary: Visibility of worksheet

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBoundSheet.SheetName
member.summary: Name of worksheet

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI
member.summary:
This record specifies a reference to data in a sheet (1) that is used by a part of a series, legend entry, trendline or error bars.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.29 BRAI

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI.id
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the part of the series, trendline, or error bars the referenced data specifies.
0x00 - Referenced data specifies the series, legend entry, or trendline name. Error bars name MUST be empty. 0x01 - Referenced data specifies the values or horizontal values on bubble and scatter chart groups of the series and error bars. 0x02 - Referenced data specifies the categories (3) or vertical values on bubble and scatter chart groups of the series and error bars. 0x03 - Referenced data specifies the bubble size values of the series.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI.rt
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the type of data that is being referenced.
0x00 - The data source (1) is a category (3) name, series name or bubble size that was automatically generated. 0x01 - The data source (1) is the text or value as specified by the formula field. 0x02 - The data source (1) is the value from a range of cells in a sheet (1) specified by the formula field.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI.fUnlinkedIfmt
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the part of the chart specified by the id field uses number formatting from the referenced data.
member.value: true if data uses the custom number formatting specified in the ifmt field; otherwise, data uses the number formatting of the referenced datafalse.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI.ifmt
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the number format to use for the data.
member.value: The the number format to use for the data.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffBRAI.formula
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the count of bubble size values in the series. The value MUST be less than or equal to 32767.
member.value: The count of bubble size values in the series.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCatSerRange
member.summary:
This record specifies the properties of a category axis, a date axis, or a series axis.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.39 CatSerRange

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCatSerRange.catCross
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies where the value axis crosses this axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCatSerRange.catLabel
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval between axis labels on this axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCatSerRange.catMark
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval at which major tick marks and minor tick marks are displayed on the axis.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart
member.summary:
This record specifies the position and size of the chart area and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream.
The position information MUST be ignored if the chart is embedded in a sheet.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.45 Chart

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart.x
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the horizontal position of the upper-left corner of the chart in points. SHOULD be greater than or equal to zero.
member.value: The horizontal position of the upper-left corner of the chart in points.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart.y
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the vertical position of the upper-left corner of the chart in points. SHOULD be greater than or equal to zero.
member.value: The vertical position of the upper-left corner of the chart in points.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart.dx
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the width in points. SHOULD be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart.dy
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the height in points. SHOULD be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d
member.summary:
This record specifies that the plot area of the chart group is rendered in a 3-D scene and also specifies the attributes of the 3-D plot area. The preceding chart group type MUST be of type bar, pie, line, area, or surface.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.46 Chart3d

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.anRot
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the clockwise rotation, in degrees, of the 3-D plot area around a vertical line through the center of the 3-D plot area. MUST be greater than or equal to 0 and MUST be less than or equal to 360. If chart group type is bar and the value of field fTranspose in the record Bar is 1, then MUST be less than or equal to 44.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.anElev
member.summary: Gets the value that specifiesthe rotation, in degrees, of the 3-D plot area around a horizontal line through the center of the 3-D plot area. MUST be greater than or equal to -90 and MUST be less than or equal to 90. If the chart group type is bar and the value of field fTranspose in the record Bar is 1, or the chart group type is pie then MUST be greater than or equal to 0. If the chart group type is bar and the value of field fTranspose in the record Bar is 1, then the value MUST be less than or equal to 44.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.pcDist
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the field of view angle for the 3-D plot area. MUST be greater than or equal to zero and less than 200. SHOULD be less than or equal to 100.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.pcHeight
P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.pcHeightPie
member.summary: If fNotPieChart is 1, gets the value that specifies the height of the 3-D plot area as a percentage of its width. SHOULD be greater than or equal to 5, MUST be less than 65535 and SHOULD be less than or equal to 500.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.pcDepth
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the depth of the 3-D plot area as a percentage of its width. MUST be greater than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 2000.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3d.pcGap
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the width of the gap between the series and the front and back edges of the 3-D plot area as a percentage of the data point depth divided by 2. If fCluster is not 1 and chart group type is not a bar then pcGap also specifies distance between adjacent series as a percentage of the data point depth. MUST be less than or equal to 500.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3DBarShape
member.summary:
This record specifies the shape of the data points in a bar or column chart group. This record is only used for a bar or column chart group and MUST be ignored for all other chart groups. This record MUST be ignored if the current substream does not contain a Chart3d record.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.47 Chart3DBarShape

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3DBarShape.riser
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the shape of the base of the data points in a bar or column chart group.
member.value: true if base of the data point is an ellipse; otherwise, base of the data point is a rectangle.false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChart3DBarShape.taper
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies how the data points in a bar or column chart group taper from base to tip. 0x00 - The data points of the bar or column chart group do not taper. The shape at the maximum value of the data point is the same as the shape at the base. 0x01 - The data points of the bar or column chart group taper to a point at the maximum value of each data point. 0x02 - The data points of the bar or column chart group taper towards a projected point at the position of the maximum value of all of the data points in the chart group, but are clipped at the value of each data point.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChartFormat
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of a chart group and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF. The collection of records specifies a chart group.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.48 ChartFormat

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChartFormat.fVaried
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies whether the color for each data point and the color and type for each data marker varies. If the chart group has multiple series, or the chart group has one series and the type is either a surface, stock, or area chart group, then this field MUST be ignored, and the data points do not vary. For all other chart group types, if the chart group has one series, then a value of 0x1 specifies that the data points vary. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0 - The color for each data point and the color and type for each data marker does not vary. 0x1 - The color for data points or the color or type for data markers varies.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffChartFormat.icrt
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the drawing order of the chart group relative to the other chart groups, where 0x0000 is the bottom of the z-order. This value MUST be unique for each instance of this record and MUST be less than or equal to 0x0009.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffColInfo.Flags
member.summary: Returns colinfo flags

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffContinue
member.summary: Represents additional space for very large records

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCrtLine
member.summary:
This record specifies the presence of drop lines, high-low lines, series lines or leader lines on the chart group.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.68 CrtLine

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCrtLine.id
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the type of line that is present on the chart group. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - Drop lines below the data points of line, area, and stock chart groups. 0x0001 - High-Low lines around the data points of line and stock chart groups. 0x0002 - Series lines connecting data points of stacked column and bar chart groups, and the primary pie to the secondary bar/pie of bar of pie and pie of pie chart groups. 0x0003 - Leader lines with non-default formatting connecting data labels to the data point of pie and pie of pie chart groups.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffCrtLink
member.summary:
This record is written but unused.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.69 CrtLink

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDataFormat
member.summary:
This record specifies the data point or series that the formatting information that follows applies to and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.74 DataFormat

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDataFormat.xi
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of the data point within the series specified by yi. If this value is 0xFFFF, the formatting information that follows applies to the series. Otherwise, the formatting information that follows applies to a data point.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDataFormat.yi
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of a Series record in the collection of Series records in this chart sheet substream.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDataFormat.iss
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies properties of the data series, trendline or error bar, depending on the type of records in sequence of records that conforms to the SERIESFORMAT rule that contains the sequence of records that conforms to the SS rule that contains this record.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDate1904.Date1904
member.summary: Version

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDbCell
member.summary: Represents cell-indexing record, finishes each row values block

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDbCell.RowAddress
member.summary: Offset of first row linked with this record

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDbCell.CellAddresses
member.summary: Addresses of cell values

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDefaultRowHeight.Height
member.summary: Height

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDefaultText
member.summary:
This record specifies the text elements that are formatted using the information specified by the Text record immediately following this record.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.88 DefaultText

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDefaultText.id
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the text elements that are formatted using the position and appearance information specified by the Text record immediately following this record. MUST be a value from the following table. 0x00 - Format all Text records in the chart group where fShowPercent is equal to 0 or fShowValue is equal to 0. 0x01 - Format all Text records in the chart group where fShowPercent is equal to 1 or fShowValue is equal to 1. 0x02 - Format all Text records in the chart where the value of fScaled of the associated FontInfo structure is equal to 0. 0x03 - Format all Text records in the chart where the value of fScaled of the associated FontInfo structure is equal to 1.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDefcolwidth.Width
member.summary: Gets the default column width in characters.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDimensions
member.summary:
This record specifies the used range of the sheet.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.90 Dimensions

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDimensions.FirstRow
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of first row in the sheet that contains a used cell.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDimensions.LastRow
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of the row after the last row in the sheet that contains a used cell. MUST be less than or equal to 0x00010000. If this value is 0x00000000, no cells on the sheet are used cells.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDimensions.FirstColumn
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of first column in the sheet that contains a used cell.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDimensions.LastColumn
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index of the column after the last column in the sheet that contains a used cell. MUST be less than or equal to 0x0100. If this value is 0x0000, no cells on the sheet are used cells.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDropBar
member.summary:
This record specifies the attributes of the up bars or the down bars between multiple series of a line.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.92 DropBar

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffDropBar.pcGap
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the width of the gap between the up bars or the down bars. MUST be a value between 0 and 500.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffEnd
member.summary:
This record specifies the end of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.99 End

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffEOF
member.summary: Represents BIFF EOF resord

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi
member.summary:
This record specifies the font information at the time the scalable font is added to the chart.
This record is always ignored in Office Excel 2007, and Excel 2010.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.109 Fbi

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi.dmixBasis
member.summary: Gets the font width, in twips, when the font was first applied. MUST be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 0x7FFF.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi.dmiyBasis
member.summary: Gets the font height, in twips, when the font was first applied. MUST be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 0x7FFF.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi.twpHeightBasis
member.summary: Gets the default font height in twips. MUST be greater than or equal to 20 and less than or equal to 8180.
member.value: The default font height in twips.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi.scab
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the scale to use.
member.value: true if scale by plot area; otherwise scale by chart area, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFbi.ifnt
member.summary:
Gets a value that specifies the font.
If this value is less than 4, then it specifies a zero-based index of a Font record in the collection of Font records in the globals substream. If this value is greater than 4, then it specifies a one-based index of a Font record in the collection of Font records in the globals substream. MUST NOT equal 4, and MUST be less than or equal to 1022.
member.value: The index of a Font record.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFileSharing
member.summary: Represents Protect record of worksheet or workbook

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFontX
member.summary:
This record specifies the font for a given text element. The Font record referenced by iFont can exist in this chart sheet substream or the workbook.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.123 FontX

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffFontX.iFont
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the font to use for subsequent records.

member.summary:
Gets a value that specifies the type of frame to be drawn.
0x0000 - A frame surrounding the chart element 0x0004 - A frame with a shadow surrounding the chart element.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of a legend, and specifies the beginning of a collection of records defined by Chart Sheet Substream ABNF. The collection of records specifies a legend. The absence of this collection of records implies that a legend does not exist on the chart.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.152 Legend

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend.x
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the x-position, in SPRC, of the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the legend. MUST be ignored and the x1 field from the following Pos record MUST be used instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend.y
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the y-position, in SPRC, of the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the legend. MUST be ignored and the y1 field from the following Pos record MUST be used instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend.dx
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the width, in SPRC, of the bounding rectangle of the legend. MUST be ignored and the x2 field from the following Pos record MUST be used instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend.dy
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the height, in SPRC, of the bounding rectangle of the legend. MUST be ignored and the y2 field from the following Pos record MUST be used instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLegend.wSpace
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the space between legend entries. MUST be 0x01, which represents 40 twips between legend entries.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLine
member.summary:
This record specifies that the chart group is a line chart group, and specifies the chart group attributes
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.155 Line

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLine.fStacked
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points in the chart group that share the same category (3) are stacked.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLine.f100
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points in the chart group are displayed as a percentage of the sum of all data points in the chart group that share the same category (3). MUST be 0 if fStacked is 0.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLine.fHasShadow
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether one or more data points in the chart group has shadows.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLineFormat
member.summary:
This record specifies the appearance of a line.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.156 LineFormat

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLineFormat.rgb
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the color of the line. The color MUST match the color specified by icv.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLineFormat.lns
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the style of the line.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLineFormat.we
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the thickness of the line.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffLineFormat.icv
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the color of the line from the chart color table. The color MUST match the color specified by rgb.
This value MUST be greater than or equal to 0x0000 and less than or equal to 0x0041, or greater than or equal to 0x004D and less than or equal to 0x00004F. This value SHOULD NOT be less than 0x0008 (???).
member.value: The color of the line from the chart color table.

This record specifies the color, size, and shape of the associated data markers that appear on line, radar, and scatter chart groups.

member.summary: Gets the interior color of the data marker.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffMarkerFormat.imk
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the type of data marker.

This record specifies a defined name.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffObjectLink
member.summary:
This record specifies an object on a chart, or the entire chart, to which the Text record is linked.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffObjectLink.wLinkObj
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the object that the Text record is linked to. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0001 - Entire chart. 0x0002 - Value axis, or vertical value axis on bubble and scatter chart groups 0x0003 - Category axis, or horizontal value axis on bubble and scatter chart groups. 0x0004 - Series or data points. 0x0007 - Series axis. 0x000C - Display units labels of an axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffObjectLink.wLinkVar1
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the zero-based index into a Series record in the collection of Series records in the current Chart Sheet substream.

member.summary:
This record specifies the position of frozen panes or unfrozen panes in the window used to display the sheet.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPane.xSplit
member.summary: Returns the horizontal position of the split in the pane.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPane.ySplit

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPassword
member.summary: Represents Password record of worksheet or workbook

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPie
member.summary:
This record specifies that the chart group is a pie chart group or a doughnut chart group, and specifies the chart group attributes.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.194 Pie

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPie.anStart
member.summary: Gets the value that specifiesthe starting angle of the first data point, clockwise from the top of the circle. MUST be less than or equal to 360.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPie.pcDonut
member.summary: Gets the value that specifiesthe size of the center hole in a doughnut chart group as a percentage of the plot area size.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPie.fHasShadow
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether one or more data points in the chart group has shadows.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPie.fShowLdrLines
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the leader lines to the data labels are shown.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPieFormat
member.summary:
This record specifies the distance of a data point or data points in a series from the center of one of the following: - The plot area for a doughnut or pie chart group. - The primary pie in a pie of pie or bar of pie chart group. - The secondary bar/pie of a pie of pie chart group.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.195 PieFormat

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPieFormat.pcExplode
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the distance as a percentage. If this value is 0, then the data point or data points in a series is as close to the center as possible for the particular chart group type. If this value is 100, then the data point is at the edge of the chart area. If this value is greater than 100, such that the data point is beyond the edge of the chart area, then all the data points in the chart group are scaled down to fit inside the chart area such that the data point with the highest pcExplode value is at the edge of the chart area. MUST be greater than or equal to 0.
member.value: true if base of the data point is an ellipse; otherwise, base of the data point is a rectangle.false.
The distance of a data point or data points.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPlotArea
member.summary:
This record is empty, specifying that the Frame record that immediately follows this record specifies properties of the plot area.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.197 PlotArea

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPlotGrowth
member.summary:
This record specifies the scale factors to use when calculating the font scaling information for a font in the plot area.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.198 PlotGrowth

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPrintSize
member.summary:
This record specifies the printed size of the chart. This record affects the charts printed only on their own page.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.204 PrintSize

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffPrintSize.printSize
member.summary:
Gets a value that specifies the printed size of the chart. MUST be a value from the following list:
0x0000 - The record is part of a UserSViewBegin block and the print settings are unchanged from the defaults specified in the workbook. 0x0001 - The chart is resized to fill the entire page regardless of the original chart proportions, within page margins. 0x0002 - The chart is resized proportionally to fill the entire page, within page margins. 0x0003 - The printed size of the chart is defined in the Chart record.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter
member.summary:
This record specifies that the chart group is a scatter chart group or a bubble chart group, and specifies the chart group attributes.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.243 Scatter

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter.pcBubbleSizeRatio
member.summary: Gets the value that specifiesthe size of the data points as a percentage of their default size. A value of 100 shows all the data points in their default size, as determined by the application. MUST be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 300. MUST be ignored if the fBubbles field is 0.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter.wBubbleSize
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies how the default size of the data points represents the value. MUST be ignored if the fBubbles field is 0. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0001 - The area of the data point represents the value. 0x0002 - The width of the data point represents the value.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter.fBubbles
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether this chart group is a scatter chart group (fBubbles == false) or bubble chart group (fBubbles == true).

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter.fShowNegBubbles
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the data points with negative values in the chart group are shown on the chart. MUST be ignored if the fBubbles field is 0.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffScatter.fHasShadow
member.summary: Gets a value that specifieswhether one or more data markers in a scatter chart group or data points in a bubble chart group have shadows.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSerFmt
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of the associated data points, data markers, or lines of the series. The associated data points, data markers, or lines of the series are specified by the preceding DataFormat record. If this record is not present in the sequence of records that conforms to the SS rule of the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF, then the properties of the associated data points, data markers, or lines of the series are specified by the default values of the fields of this record.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.251 SerFmt

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSerFmt.fSmoothedLine
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the lines of the series are displayed with a smooth line effect on a scatter, radar, and line chart group.
The default value of this field is 0.
member.value: true if smoothed line; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSerFmt.f3DBubbles
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whetherthe data points of a bubble chart group are displayed with a 3-D effect. MUST be ignored for all other chart groups.
The default value of this field is 0.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSerFmt.fArShadow
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the data markers are displayed with a shadow on bubble, scatter, radar, stock, and line chart groups.
The default value of this field is 0.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries
member.summary:
This record specifies properties of the data for a series, a trendline, or error bars, and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.252 Series

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.sdtX
member.summary:
Gets the value that specifies the type of data in categories (3), or horizontal values on bubble and scatter chart groups, in the series.
0x0001 - The series contains numeric information. 0x0003 - The series contains text information.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.sdtY
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies that the values or vertical values on bubble and scatter chart groups, in the series contain numeric information.
member.value: It MUST be 0x0001 and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.cValx
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the count of categories (3), or horizontal values on bubble and scatter chart groups, in the series. The value MUST be less than or equal to 32767.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.cValy
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the count of values, or vertical values on bubble and scatter chart groups, in the series. The value MUST be less than or equal to 32767.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.sdtBSize
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies that the bubble size values in the series contain numeric information.
member.value: The value MUST be 0x0001, and MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSeries.cValBSize
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the count of bubble size values in the series. The value MUST be less than or equal to 32767.
member.value: The count of bubble size values in the series.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffShtProps.mdBlank
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies how the empty cells are plotted be a value from the following table: 0x00 - Empty cells are not plotted. 0x01 - Empty cells are plotted as zero. 0x02 - Empty cells are plotted as interpolated.

member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the type of the data records contained by the Number records following it. This record specifies that the chart group is a surface chart group and specifies the chart group attributes.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.272 Surf

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSurf.fFillSurface
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the surface chart group is wireframe or has a fill. MUST be a value from the following table: 0 - Surface chart group is wireframe. 1 - Surface chart group has a fill.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffSurf.f3DPhongShade
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the 3-D Phong shading is displayed.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText
member.summary:
This record specifies the properties of an attached label and specifies the beginning of a collection of records as defined by the chart sheet substream ABNF.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.324 Text

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.at
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the horizontal alignment of the text. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x01 - Left-alignment if iReadingOrder specifies left-to-right reading order; otherwise, right-alignment 0x02 - Center-alignment 0x03 - Right-alignment if iReadingOrder specifies left-to-right reading order; otherwise, left-alignment 0x04 - Justify-alignment 0x07 - Distributed alignment

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.vat
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the vertical alignment of the text. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x01 - Top-alignment 0x02 - Center-alignment 0x03 - Bottom-alignment 0x04 - Justify-alignment 0x07 - Distributed alignment

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.wBkgMode
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the display mode of the background of the text. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0001 - Transparent background 0x0002 - Opaque background

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.rgbText
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the color of the text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.x
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the horizontal position of the text, relative to the upper-left of the chart area in SPRC.
member.value: The horizontal position of the text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.y
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the vertical position of the text, relative to the upper-left of the chart area in SPRC.
member.value: The vertical position of the text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.dx
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the horizontal size of the text, relative to the chart area in SPRC.
member.value: The horizontal size of the text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.dy
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the vertical size of the text, relative to the chart area in SPRC.
member.value: The vertical size of the text.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.icvText
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the color of the text in the color table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffText.trot
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the text rotation. MUST be a value from the following table: 0 to 90 - Text rotated 0 to 90 degrees counter-clockwise 91 to 180 - Text rotated 1 to 90 degrees clockwise (angle is trot 90) 255 - Text top-to-bottom with letters upright

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick
member.summary:
This record specifies the attributes of the axis labels, major tick marks, and minor tick marks associated with an axis.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.327 Tick

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.tktMajor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the location of major tick marks. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - None. No major tick marks are drawn on the axis. 0x0001 - Inside. Major tick marks are drawn toward the plot area. 0x0002 - Outside. Major tick marks are drawn away from the plot area. 0x0003 - Crossing. Major tick marks are drawn evenly on both sides of the axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.tktMinor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the location of minor tick marks. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - None. No minor tick marks are present on the axis. 0x0001 - Inside. Minor tick marks are drawn toward the plot area. 0x0002 - Outside. Minor tick marks are drawn away from the plot area. 0x0003 - Crossing. Minor tick marks are drawn evenly on both sides of the axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.tlt
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the location of axis labels. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0000 - None. No axis labels are present on the axis. 0x0001 - Low. Axis labels are drawn to the left of the plot area for a vertical axis or below the plot area for a horizontal axis for all chart group types except radar. Axis labels for radar chart group types will be drawn as if the value was 0x0003. 0x0002 - High. Axis labels are drawn to the right of the plot area for a vertical axis or above the plot area for a horizontal axis for all chart group types except radar. Axis labels for radar chart group types will be drawn as if the value was 0x0003. 0x0003 - Next to Axis. Axis labels are drawn next to the axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.wBkgMode
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the display mode of the background of the text of the axis labels. MUST be ignored if the value of fAutoCo is 1. MUST be a value from the following table: 0x0001 - Transparent background 0x0002 - Opaque background. The background color will match the rgbBack field in the associated AreaFormat record as specified by the AXS rule in the Chart Sheet Substream ABNF.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.rgb
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the color of the text for the axis labels. MUST be ignored if fAutoCo is 1.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.icv
member.summary: Gets the value thatspecifies the color of the text. The color MUST be the same as rgb.
member.value: The color of the line from the chart color table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffTick.trot
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the axis labels text rotation. MUST be a value from the following table: 0 to 90 - Text rotated 0 to 90 degrees counterclockwise 91 to 180 - Text rotated 1 to 90 degrees clockwise (angle is trot 90) 255 - Text top-to-bottom with letters upright

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffUnits
member.summary:
This record MUST be zero, and MUST be ignored.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.332 Units

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange
member.summary:
This record specifies the properties of a value axis.
Please take a look at: Excel Binary File Format Specification, 2.4.341 ValueRange

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange.numMin
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the minimum value of the value axis. MUST be less than the value of numMax. If the value of fAutoMin is 1, this field MUST be ignored.
member.value: The minimum value of the value axis

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange.numMax
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the maximum value of the value axis. MUST be greater than the value of numMin. If the value of fAutoMax is 1, this field MUST be ignored.
member.value: The maximum value of the value axis.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange.numMajor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval at which major tick marks and major gridlines are displayed. MUST be greater than or equal to the value of numMinor. If the value of fAutoMajor is 1, this field MUST be ignored.
member.value: The interval at which major tick marks.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange.numMinor
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies the interval at which minor tick marks and minor gridlines are displayed. MUST be greater than or equal to zero. If the value of fAutoMinor is 1, this field MUST be ignored.
member.value: The interval at which minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Records.XlsBiffValueRange.numCross
member.summary: Gets the value that specifies at which value the other axes in the axis group cross this value axis. If the value of fAutoCross is 1, this field MUST be ignored.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.Workbook.Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets the CultureInfo using in Workbook. This property should be used to set the locale (regional) settings for use in the new workbook (number, currency, time, date formatting). When you load existing spreadsheet then the SDK tries to use the saved locale settings for this file disregarding current Windows regional and language settings. When new workbook is created then the current Windows locale is used by default.

members.member: Copies length bytes from input buffer to output buffer starting at output[offset]. You have to make sure, that the buffer is byte aligned. If not enough bytes are available, copies fewer bytes. Returns the number of bytes copied, 0 if no byte is available.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile
member.summary: The ZipFile type represents a zip archive file. This is the main type in the class library that reads and writes zip files, as defined in the format for zip described by PKWare. This implementation is based on the Compression.DeflateStream base class in the .NET Framework base class library, for v2.0 and later.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ZipFile instance for an existing zip archive, using the specified file name. The file name may be fully qualified.
member.param: The name of the existing zip archive.

remarks.para: Applications can use this constructor to create a new ZipFile for an existing zip archive for read and write purposes.

An application reading a zip archive can call this constructor, passing the name of a zip file that does exist. The file is then read into the ZipFile instance. The app can then enumerate the entries or can add a new entry.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates an instance of ZipFile initialized with zip archive data from a specified stream.
member.exception: Thrown if the stream is not readable or empty.
member.param: The stream to read from. It must be readable and contain zip archive. Stream does not gets closed.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of ZipFile initialized with zip archive data from a specified byte buffer.
member.param: The byte array containing the zip data.
member.exception: Thrown if the byte buffer is null or empty.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Finalize
member.summary: This is the class Destructor, which gets called implicitly when the instance is destroyed. Because the ZipFile type implements IDisposable, this method calls Dispose(false).

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Dispose
member.summary: Handles closing of the read and write streams associated to the ZipFile, if necessary. The Dispose() method is generally employed implicitly, via a using() {} statement.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The Dispose() method. It disposes any managed resources, if the flag is set, then marks the instance disposed. This method is typically not called from application code.
member.param: indicates whether the method should dispose streams or not.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Generic IEnumerator support, for use of a ZipFile in a foreach construct.
member.returns: a generic enumerator suitable for use within a foreach loop.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: IEnumerator support, for use of a ZipFile in a foreach construct.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.AddItem(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an item, either a file or a folder, to the zip archive.

remarks.para: If adding a folder, then add is NOT recursive and only empty folder will be added to zip archive.
The name of the item may be a relative path or a fully-qualified path. If name is null, then empty entry will be added. You can populate entry using Stream property later.
The folder name used for the file within the archive is the same as folder name (potentially a relative path) specified in the fileOrFolderName.

member.param: the name of the file or folder to add.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.AddItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an item, either a file or a folder, to the zip archive, explicitly specifying the folder path to be used in the archive.

remarks.para: If adding a folder, then add is NOT recursive and only empty folder will be added to zip archive.
The name of the item may be a relative path or a fully-qualified path. If name is null, then empty entry will be added. You can populate entry using Stream property later.
This version of the method allows the caller to explicitly specify the folder path to be used in the archive, which would override the "natural" path of the filesystem file.

member.param: the name of the file or folder to add.

The name of the folder path to use within the zip archive. This path may, or may not, correspond to a real folder in the current filesystem. If the files within the zip are later extracted, this is the path used for the extracted file. Passing null will use the path of the fileOrFolderName. Passing the empty string ("") will insert the item at the root path within the archive.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.AddFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a folder to the zip archive.
member.remarks: The name of the folder may be a relative path or a fully-qualified path. The add operation is recursive, so that any files or sub-folders within the folder are also added to the archive.
member.param: the name of the folder to add.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.AddFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a folder to the zip archive, overriding the path to be used in the archive.
member.remarks: The name of the folder may be a relative path or a fully-qualified path. The add operation is recursive, so that any files or sub-folders within the folder are also added to the archive.
member.param: the name of the folder to add.

Specifies a folder path to use to override any path in the folderName. This path may, or may not, correspond to a real folder in the current filesystem. If the zip archive is later extracted, this is the path used for the extracted file or folder. Passing null will use the path of the folderName. Passing the empty string ("") will insert the item at the root path within the archive.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Save the zip archive to a file with the given name.
member.param: The name of the file to save zip archive to. If file already exists, it will be overwritten.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Save(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Save the zip archive to a given stream.
member.param: The name of the stream to save zip archive to. Stream must be writable. Stream does not gets closed.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Extract(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts all of the items in the zip archive, to the specified path in the filesystem. The path can be relative or fully-qualified.

remarks.para: If an extraction of a file from the zip archive would overwrite an existing file in the filesystem, the file will not be overwritten and an exception will be thrown. To avoid this, use the overload that allows you to specify that you want to overwrite existing files.

member.param: The path to which the contents of the zip archive should be extracted.

member.name: M:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Extract(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts all of the items in the zip archive, to the specified path in the filesystem, optionally overwriting any existing files. The path can be relative or fully-qualified.
member.param: the path to which the contents of the zip archive are extracted.
If true, then any existing file will be overwritten upon extraction.

member.summary: Gets the number of zip entries in the zip archive.
member.value: The number of zip entries in the zip archive.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a number-based indexer into the zip archive.
member.value: The index of an entry to retrieve.

member.name: P:Bytescout.Zip.ZipFile.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment for the zip file.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.CONST_SpaceRatioBetweenWords
member.summary: This constant defines default number of spaces to separate text blocks inside one single row (line) as different groups For most files it is enought to use 1.0f when doing text extraction Some files with small fonts may require 1.2f or 1.1f Please change this default carefully, probably it is better to tell the customer to change .SpaceRatioBetweenWords property instead of changing the default consant for the property

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.ExtractInvisibleText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract invisible text from PDF document.
member.value: true if extract invisible text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.ExtractShadowLikeText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include characters used to create "shadow" effect (when the same character appears with some offset) from PDF document. True by default (includes all encoded characters disregarding their real appearance)
member.value: true if extract shadow like characters in text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the text formatting on the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.DetectLinesInsteadOfParagraphs
member.summary: Tries to detect single lines instead of multiple lines.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.TrimSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to remove trailing and ending spaces from table cell values.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.ExtractColumnByColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text column by column or use the visual layout of the text while extracting. False by default. if you are processing PDF newspapers with text columns, set this property to True so you get column by column instead of line by line
member.value: true if extract column by column; otherwise extracts line by line (default), false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.SpaceRatioBetweenWords
member.summary: Space ratio between words.

member.summary: Contains the location (rectangle) of the text found by Find() or FindNext() methods.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.RegexSearch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to search the text using regular expresions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the page separator character or string. Default is '\f'.
